reviews.text:
DO NOT TAKE YOUR CHILD THERE especially if you have to go back to work because they will reject him even after they appoint him a place!!!!

Very disappointed with their services and professionalism. They accepted my son and then told me that they will not offer him a place because they did not see him playing (!!!!!!!!!). After one taster session with dozens of parents and children and just 40 minutes into his actual classroom they expected a 2.5 years old toddler to settle but DID NOT DO ANYTHING to make him feel comfortable.

They don't respond to calls or emails so had to chase them several days every time I contacted them. Eventually they ghosted me completely.

I had a really disappointing experience at South Acton Nursery School and Children’s Centre  with my child. The teacher's approach of asking me to leave my child alone for 20 minutes, as soon as we got in, made my child uncomfortable, and he clung to me, not wanting to play. The teacher was pushy, pressuring me to leave him for 10 minutes, then 5 minutes, and finally proposed taking him from my arms. When they did take him, my child cried and was left on the floor, still upset.

The staff also misunderstood my child's previous playtime at home and placed him in the wrong group. The taster session with parents was chaotic, and my child needed more personal space. I felt that South Acton Nursery School and Children’s Centre's expectations for a 2.5-year-old to thrive in such a short time were unrealistic, and they lacked the friendly approach and time children need to settle. I explained this to the staff, but they didn't listen and gave vague responses. This experience left me frustrated and disappointed.

Eventually, we were told that they would not offer him a place and took the decision based ONLY on a 40 minutes class taster session.

CHEVRONE was very unprofessional and Seibina Downes the Deputy Head Teacher did not even reply to my email describing the entire experience.

Very pleased with all the services that I've received here, including the health visitor clinics and baby/children play sessions. Spacious indoor and outdoor facilities.

My child is also very happy at the nursery. Very friendly teachers and good curriculum.

Ofsted Rated 'Outstanding'
Always busy .We live 5 min walk from center Every time we coming they said We are busy so many people.Always problems.Never experienced in any centre(((

address: Castle Cl, London W3 8RX, United Kingdom
